data.title: Tartakovsky Dmitry
data.meta_description:
Tartakovsky Dmitry - Free ebook download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read book online for free. This dissertation explores the political and social debates within Jewish communities in 
Bessarabia and Transnistria between 1918 and 1940. During this period, the region was divided 
by the Romanian occupation of Bessarabia and the establishment of a border along the Dniester 
River between Romania and the Soviet Union. Jewish communities on both sides of the border 
faced modernizing states promoting exclusion, discrimination, and assimilationist policies. 
Despite state efforts, contacts between Jews across the border remained significant. The desire of 
secular Jewish leaders to modernize their communities reached across ideological divides, but 
ultimately faced challenges in both Romanian and Soviet contexts.
